meanings.definition: The quality or state of being interchangeable.
meanings.sent1: The interchangeabilities of these parts make them easy to switch out.
meanings.sent2: The interchangeabilities of these tools allow for seamless replacement.
meanings.sent3: The mix-up at the party was due to the interchangeabilities of the identical gift bags.
meanings.sent4: In the world of puzzles, the interchangeabilities of pieces can lead to confusion.
meanings.sent5: The interchangeabilities of keys in a keyboard make typing efficient.

meanings.definition: The ability to be exchanged or substituted for one another.
meanings.sent1: The interchangeabilities of currencies simplify international trade.
meanings.sent2: The interchangeabilities of ingredients in this recipe make it versatile.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick relied on the interchangeabilities of the cards.
meanings.sent4: In nature, the interchangeabilities of roles can lead to balance in ecosystems.
meanings.sent5: The interchangeabilities of roles in the play allowed for flexible casting.
